docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 5-- The State Department announced today a relaxation of American visa requirements for foreigners. It is designed to stimulate travel to the United States in 1967--designated International Tourist Year by the United Nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 5-- The State Department announced today a relaxation of American visa requirements for foreigners. It is designed to stimulate travel to the United States in 1967--designated International Tourist Year by the United Nations.
docs.abstract: Govt, in recognition of '67 Intematl Tourist Yr, to offer indefinite, multiple-entry visas to natls of 24 countries; list; move may be extended to other nations if they relax visa requirements for Amers

headline.main: U.S. Relaxes Visas To Attract Tourists; VISA RULES EASED TO DRAW TOURISTS

byline.original: By HEDRICK SMITH special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 5--A number of proposals were offered by Senate Republicans today in an effort to give President Johnson full Congressional backing for the Western Hemisphere summit meeting.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 5--A number of proposals were offered by Senate Republicans today in an effort to give President Johnson full Congressional backing for the Western Hemisphere summit meeting.
docs.abstract: Repubs propose to affirm bipartisan support for Johnson; Sen Cooper offers resolution; Sens Javits and Aiken reptdly plan own versions; Johnson procedure seen key to dispute; Fulbright group irked by lack of prior consultation, loose wording and fear that adoption would reduce Sen to 'rubber stamp'; some opponents also seen separating selves politically from Adm

headline.main: G.O.P. SENATORS HUNT A LATIN PLAN; But Move to Back Johnson With Summit Resolution Is Snagged by Disunity

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, April 6--A good reporter even on a short trip should be able to find a big place like Latin America, but it is not easy and in actual fact Latin America may not even exist except in name. There are twenty sovereign states reaching from...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, April 6--A good reporter even on a short trip should be able to find a big place like Latin America, but it is not easy and in actual fact Latin America may not even exist except in name. There are twenty sovereign states reaching from the Rio Grande to the South Pole ten thousand miles away.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 6-- The White House announced today that President Johnson would leave Andrews Air Force Base Monday night on a nonstop flight to Montevideo, Uruguay. From there he will fly 80 miles by helicopter to the beach resort of Punta del...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 6-- The White House announced today that President Johnson would leave Andrews Air Force Base Monday night on a nonstop flight to Montevideo, Uruguay. From there he will fly 80 miles by helicopter to the beach resort of Punta del Este.

headline.main: JOHNSON TO LEAVE MONDAY FOR TALKS; Latin Mission Is Endorsed by Republican Leaders

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Saturday, April 8--A major trucking shutdown was at least temporarily averted early this morning when industry negotiations decided to keep bargaining with the teamsters' union despite scattered work stoppages.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Saturday, April 8--A major trucking shutdown was at least temporarily averted early this morning when industry negotiations decided to keep bargaining with the teamsters' union despite scattered work stoppages.
docs.abstract: Trucking Employers decides to delay lockout and continue talks despite scattered strikes; calls on Fitzsimmons to end walkouts; Simkin comments

headline.main: LOCKOUT AVERTED IN TRUCK DISPUTE; Industry Negotiators Agree to Keep Talking Despite Scattered Stoppages

docs.snippet: Prominent figures in business, labor and politics from 10 Western Hemisphere countries agreed here yesterday to set up two committees to work toward the formation of a common market for Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: Prominent figures in business, labor and politics from 10 Western Hemisphere countries agreed here yesterday to set up two committees to work toward the formation of a common market for Latin America.
docs.abstract: Sen Javits and Dr Lleras Camargo form 2 coms to work toward formation of Latin-Amer common mkt; Javits says reason for having 2 coms is to stress that Latin group is working without outside interference

headline.main: NEW GROUP TO AID LATIN TRADE UNITY; Hemisphere Leaders Agree to Form Committees
